text: CBS ’ new top programming executives addressed the network ’ s struggles with onscreen diversity Tuesday — including the recent controversy over the departure of two Asian actors from “ Hawaii Five - 0. ” “ We love both those actors and did not want to lose them, ” CBS Entertainment president Kelly Kahl said at the Television Critics Association press tour on Tuesday. “ We made very, very strong attempts to keep them and offered them a lot of money to stick around. ” In June, actors Daniel Dae Kim and Grace Park exited “ Hawaii Five - O. ” As Variety reported at the time, the actors had been seeking equal pay with stars Alex O ’ Loughlin and Scott Caan, but failed to reach deals with CBS Television Studios, which produces the series. The departure of the show ’ s only two series regulars of Asian descent
